problem.p: Rank the following terms by order of growth, from smallest to largest. Drag each term to its proper place on the diagram; be sure to use each term exactly once.

customresponse.answer:
correct_answer = [{'draggables': ['0'], 'targets': ['0'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['1'], 'targets': ['1'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['2'], 'targets': ['2'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['3'], 'targets': ['3'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['4'], 'targets': ['4'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['5'], 'targets': ['5'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['6'], 'targets': ['6'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['7'], 'targets': ['7'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['8'], 'targets': ['8'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' },{'draggables': ['9'], 'targets': ['9'], 'rule':'unordered_equal' }]
if draganddrop.grade(submission[0], correct_answer): correct = ['correct'] else: correct = ['incorrect']

problem.p: Reminder: You do not lose points for trying a problem multiple times, nor do you lose points if you hit "Show Answer". If this problem has you stumped after you've tried it a few times, feel free to reveal the solution.

div.p: In order from smallest to largest the answer is:

This exercise was rather complex and relied a lot on knowing the specific relationships between different functions. Don't stress too hard if you had to look at the answer to this question to get everything in the proper order - we wanted you to have a chance to stretch your brain on this exercise.
For further reference on complexity orders, you may wish to review these notes on Big O notation.
